ACM: Allow cleaning ATR crystal mode during measurement
AFM: 0: normal aperture measurement 1: fine aperture measurement
ALA: Detector area ratio free  or  Correction Parameter A
ALC: Use baseline correction for LWN-Calibration (make ScSm horizontal), used for firmware (AAR.ini)
AMD: Enforce measurement of spectra to database, 0: No, 1: Yes
AOF: file name of the aperture test OPUS file
AOO: relative path for the aperture test OPUS file
AR1: Report type (0: single sample, 1: multi sample)
AR4: Output option (1: Printer, 2: Clipboard, 4: PDF, 8: CSV, 16: EMF, or sum of these values)
ARU: Spectrum files to be unloaded, hidden parameter
ASD: Add Spectra in Setup functions connects to database, 0: No, 1: Yes
AUT: Authentication for DB, 0: Windows authentication, 1: Database authentication
AUX: Parameters set by e.g. PROCESS or OPUSLAB
AVI: If set to 1, the cluster with class 0 is ignored when AVC is 0
AX1: spectrum frame wavenumber limit 1, hidden parameter
AX2: spectrum frame wavenumber limit 2, hidden parameter
AXS: Trace Index to use as Axis
AY1: spectrum frame value limit 1, hidden parameter
AY2: spectrum frame value limit 2, hidden parameter
CFE: Low intensity power mode with DTGS
CFS: Low intensity power mode with DTGS
CLK: Identification Method (0: Quick Compare 1: Library Search)
CPB: Array of spectra to be averaged
CRS: Use images from OPUS file for detection
CXU: X Units: Convert nanometer or micrometer to wavenumber
DPS: Number of division in the range of particles size
EIH: Height of the image in pixels
EII: Index of the image in the data file
EIR: Resolution of the exported image in dpi
EIT: Format type of the exported image (BMP=0, JPG=1)
EIU: Unit used for the dimensions of width and height of the image (MM=0,CM=1,INCH=2)
EIW: Width of the image in pixels
ENC: If non-zero, indicates that input parameters of a function are given in the specified encoding (as per Windows codepage identifiers, including CP_UTF8 etc).
EPH: Hidden parm for 'EditParameter-function' : Set only the parameters specified (CNM SNM SFM EPC RSN XTX YTX ZTX XAF YAF YAZ)
ERO: Open result view immediately ,  Print eval. results automatically
ETY: 0: Spectra only export, 1: Delete spectra files only, 2: Delete all Information
EXE: Extract to (0: To Block, 1: To End of file)
EXS: Extract from (0: From Block, 1: From Beginning of file)
FAI: 0: normal aperture image 1: fallback aperture image
FDA: Factory detector parameter for ATR channel
FDR: Factory detector parameter for reflection channel
FDT: Factory detector parameter for transmission channel
FRY: Name of the cluster trace for trace input
GNK: galvano scanner number of points for kinetics measurement
GNX: galvano scanner num points x direction
GNY: galvano scanner num points y direction
GNZ: galvano scanner num points z direction
IBA: Initial value of laser B Amplitude
IME: Integration Method , e. g., interactive - see INTEGRATION_... in evaluatef.h
IRD: Delay of IR against laser in raw data periods
LB4: String to search for in CListScan
LCN: Converted product file type (OPX or XML)
LCX: X coordinate of LWN correction model center
LCY: Y coordinate of LWN correction model center
LDO: Miscellaneous flags: 1<<0 : Show intermediate spectra of calculation
LDR: Wavenumber in which range the water bands shall be compared
LRI: Handle missing info block (0=Edit, 1=create standard, 2=skip spectrum)
LRU: Sequence of actions available in wizard
MAU: String to specify warning or alarm limits for quantitative results used in the ME Test function
MDA: Detector slot specific detector to aperture magnification
MEB: String to specify an external bias for Quant 2 components used in ME Test function
MER: Specifies the position of an analysis report line in the ME report, e.g. 2,3,1 means: Main Report 2, Sub Report 3, Row 1
MFD: Max file delay in seconds for HTML transfer
MFS: Max file size in megabytes for HTML transfer
MLW: Minimum Spectrum Line Width in Plot
N06: N06 parameters (global options) as xml file
NAE: Maximum allowed extrapolation in winner class (%, should be >100)
NAN: 402040 parameter: Maximum activation of all other neurons
NFL: Nominal FW Peak Pos in Points
NLP: Raman Nominal Laser Power in mW
NWA: WTA parameter: Minimum activation of winner neuron
NWD: WTA parameter: Minimum distance to next activation
NWN: 402040 parameter: Minimum activation of winner neuron
OFP: Path of output file for average of cluster
OFU: OPUS function name in case of interactive otherwise else nor present
OOA: FPA Optic Operator for atr channel
OOR: FPA Optic Operator for reflection channel
OOT: FPA Optic Operator for transmission channel
OPT: Option, corresponds to the buttons in LiveAperture dialog
PCX: OPUS/ONET alternative provided XPM file with path
PD1: Quant3 SVR Prediction, Spectrum File Path
PD2: Quant3 SVR Prediction, Spectrum File Name
PGS: Number of points used for basis vector
PLN: Plugin Name for OVP data query
PLU: List of last used scenario files
PM1: Quant3 SVR Prediction, Model File Path
PM2: Quant3 SVR Prediction, Model File Name
PO2: number of positions in x direction
PO3: number of positions in y direction
PO4: x position of the first corner of the definition area
PO5: y position of the first corner of the definition area
PO6: x position of the oposite corner of the definition area
PO7: y position of the oposite corner of the definition area
QA5: 1: Add to List in Ident Method
QEF: QM Export Manufactoring Order number FAUF
QEK: QM Export Customer order number KAUF
QEO: QM Export Ovp Userdata xml file name
QF4: Start New FIT With Last Result
QFE: No Ref. Def. (0); Sel. SNM or from table (1); Sel. Group-Name (2)
QFI: Length of SNM part for check
QFJ: Ident: Analy (0); Add List (1); Rem. All (2); Update AV.REP (3)
QFK: Ident: Path of Fl. to be Added
QFL: Ident: Name of Fl. to be Added
QI0: Ident: BlockID of Fl. to be Added
QRS: Quant 1 Show Results Immediately 0: No, 1: Yes
QT1: Trace Cal.: Trace Points by Macro
R2D: Index of Spectrum to be Replaced
RDD: Raw Data Rate divisor for calculating the external trigger rate
RDS: Number of time segments within raw data period
RF0: floating point result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RF1: floating point result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RF2: floating point result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RF3: floating point result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RF4: floating point result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RF5: floating point result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RF6: floating point result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RF7: floating point result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RF9: floating point result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RI0: integer result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RI1: integer result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RI2: integer result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RI3: integer result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RI4: integer result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RI5: integer result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RI6: integer result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RI7: integer result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RI8: integer result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RI9: integer result value, could be used as return value from an OPUS function
RPW: Reset password, old password not required
RT0: Coded Parameters for Edit Trace List
SGF: Galvano scanner number of data points
SMI: Index of selected Method Type in Sign Method function
SPI: Start position for the image stack
STD: Step Scan Pos. Delay in msec
TCL: Command line for Additional Data Treatment
TSJ: Type of JCAMP spectra, 0: Foss, 1: Büchi, 2: Bran+Luebbe, 3: Others: Absorbance, 4: Others: Transmittance
UAS: Use aperture images from OPUS file
VCI: VCD Calibration is Interferogram or calculated
WEB: Optional parameter for Quant 2 Analysis, analysis results shall be returned as string for Web Service
WOU: 0: write all used image lines 1: write only used image lines
